revised_title: High-Frequency Electromagnetic Waves Propagation in Magnetized Plasma
tldr: This article explores the propagation of high-frequency electromagnetic waves through a magnetized plasma in curved space-time. The authors apply the asymptotic approximation method to study the dispersion relation, rays, polarization states, and transport laws for these waves. The findings have implications for understanding phenomena such as gamma rays, gravitational waves, and early universe processes.
